Description: Very heavy axe-head: with rounded sides and bearing, lightly chased on one face an inscription, reading from left to right and carelessly done. On the other face, near one of the corners of the butt, a number of small marks have been punched indiscriminately into the surface. The cutting edge has been turned and chipped through use but is still quite sharp. One of the sides bears shallow indentations caused by a round-headed implement.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (21)
